featured.text: Carnegie became a very rich businessman and set aside money to honor heroes like William.
Over 6,000 people have received the Carnegie Medal.
The medal was named after Andrew Carnegie.

other.text: The Carnegie Medal is given to those who are (A) sick and poor.
One such reward is the Carnegie Medal.
In 1886, Carnegie heard about a young man by the name of William Hunter who lost his life trying to save two other boys from drowning.
If so, they receive money as well as the Carnegie Medal.
What is the main idea of the passage? (A) William Hunter was a very brave boy. (B) Hunter saved Carnegie from drowning.
Which of the following statements is NOT true? (A) Carnegie knew Hunter in person.

definition.zh_def: 卡內基（Andrew Carnegie）是美國的鋼鐵大亨和慈善家，以其在鋼鐵產業的成功和對教育及公共事業的貢獻而聞名。
definition.en_def: Carnegie refers to Andrew Carnegie, a Scottish-American industrialist who led the expansion of the American steel industry in the late 19th century and is known for his philanthropic efforts.
definition.example: Andrew Carnegie donated millions to libraries and educational institutions across the United States.
